A paz passou longe das redes sociais nesta quinta-feira (20). A cantora Manu Bahtid√£o e o influenciador Tokinho entraram em um verdadeiro embate p√∫blico, trocando acusa√ß√µes que deixaram a internet em polvorosa. Tudo come√ßou ap√≥s um v√≠deo da artista viralizar, mostrando um momento pol√™mico durante sua participa√ß√£o no Rancho do Maia, reality comandado por Carlinhos Maia.
LEIA TAMB√âM: Lucas Lucco revela que perdeu chance de conhecer Post Malone
No registro, Manu aparece retirando a influenciadora P√¥nei do palco enquanto cantava, e a atitude n√£o foi bem recebida por Tokinho, que fez quest√£o de criticar publicamente o comportamento da cantora. ‚ÄúT√° a√≠ uma pessoa que n√£o me desce. P√¥nei sempre animada, sempre se jogando porque Carlinhos pede. Essa cantora, na primeira oportunidade que tem de desmerecer algu√©m, vai l√° e faz‚Äù, disparou
A resposta de Manu veio sem rodeios. Irritada com a cr√≠tica, a estrela do piseiro rebateu na mesma moeda. ‚ÄúVai te tratar, mulher! Qual √© o teu problema comigo? Eu amo a P√¥nei, somos amigas, e n√£o √© a primeira vez que vou ao Rancho. L√° me divirto e curto com meus amigos, e se voc√™ n√£o sabe, tudo l√° √© brincadeira e alegria. Eu hein! Quer jogar hater pra mim pra aparecer? T√° louca? Nunca te dei nem confian√ßa!‚Äù, rebateu Manu
Mas a treta estava longe de acabar. Tokinho n√£o deixou barato e soltou novas revela√ß√µes que pegaram muita gente de surpresa. Ele afirmou que Manu tentou se aproximar dele em outros momentos e at√© o convidou para seu bloco de carnaval, mas sem estar disposta a pagar pelo trabalho. ‚ÄúNunca me deu confian√ßa, mas pediu pro assessor ir ao seu quarto pegar uma camisa pra mim, pra me presentear na hora do almo√ßo na Farofa da Gkay, querendo me comprar com isso. Depois, veio me chamando pra participar do seu bloco em Bel√©m do Par√°, at√© aceitei, por√©m pagando. N√£o quis pagar pelo meu trabalho, n√£o fui‚Äù, contou.
O influenciador ainda exp√¥s um epis√≥dio que teria acontecido na Farofa da Gkay, onde, segundo ele, Manu tentou constrang√™-lo em p√∫blico. ‚ÄúNa primeira oportunidade que teve, me gritou do palco junto com outra pessoa, chamando a gente de metido porque n√£o subimos na hora da sua gritaria e ainda xingou, achando que eu ia me sentir mal. Se toca, mulher! Voc√™ n√£o √© ningu√©m pra desmerecer os outros!‚Äù, disparou Tokinho.
Para fechar com chave de ouro, o influenciador insinuou que a presen√ßa de Manu no Rancho do Maia s√≥ aconteceu porque ela teria investido dinheiro para promover sua imagem. ‚ÄúTu t√° a√≠ sabe por qu√™, n√©?! Deve ter soltado dinheiro. L√° na Farofa falaram que tava pagando pra te divulgar na √©poca, parecia prefeita querendo ser eleita‚Äù, alfinetou.
The post TRETA! Manu Bahtid√£o perde a paci√™ncia e troca farpas com influenciador appeared first on Super R√°dio Tupi.

author: Devon Forward
title: Paul Walker's Daughter Meadow Shares Big Relationship Update
text:
Paul Walker's Daughter Meadow Shares Big Relationship Update
At the end of 2023, Meadow Walker, the 25-year-old daughter of the late Fast & Furious actor
Paul Walker, made a big announcement regarding her marriage.
Just over two years after she got married to Louis Thornton-Allan in October 2021, Meadow announced that the two were splitting up in a joint statement with Thornton-Allan on Instagram.
On Wednesday, Dec. 27, the model shared a photo on social media of the "statement from the two of us," which read, ‚ÄúAfter three wonderful years of marriage, we have come to the agreement to amicably separate. This is truly a united decision and we sincerely hope that everyone can respect our wishes for privacy.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe maintain mutual love and respect for one another, and will continue to support each other," the message concluded.
Many people shared words of support for Meadow in the comments, with friends "sending love" to the 25-year-old. A fan wrote, "Nothing but love and respect for you!!‚ù§Ô∏è You are amazing, love you!üèª."
Meadow and Thornton-Allan tied the knot in late 2021 in the Dominican Republic, sharing
a clip from the wedding on Instagram with the excited message, "we‚Äôre married !!!!"
The ceremony was attended by Meadow's godfather and her father Paul's co-star and close friend, Vin Diesel, while another Fast & Furious star Jordana Brewster, who played Paul's love interest Mia, was reportedly also in attendance.
Meadow also marked the couple's one-year anniversary last fall with a sweet snap of the two embracing, writing, "Happy anniversary my love! One year married to you ."
Earlier this year, Meadow celebrated her father in a very special way by making a
small cameo in the latest Fast & Furious film, Fast X. She appeared at the film's premiere in Rome, looking stunning in a stylish ensemble as she posed with Diesel.

author: cari
title: Support grows for the Gitanyow Hereditary Chiefs‚Äô call for the Environmental Assessment Office/B.C. government to pause environmental assessment process for the Ksi Lisims LNG project
text: Support grows for the Gitanyow Hereditary Chiefs‚Äô call for the Environmental Assessment Office/B.C. government to pause environmental assessment process for the Ksi Lisims LNG project February 14, 2024 Vancouver (Unceded Musqueam, Squamish, and Tsleil-Waututh Territories) ‚Äî Five B.C.-based organizations concur with [concerns](https://www.gitanyowchiefs.com/news/gitanyow-challenges-ksi-lisims-lng-to-prove-ghg-reduction-promises/) raised by the Gitanyow Hereditary Chiefs about substantial deficiencies in Ksi Lisims‚Äô application to the B.C. Environmental Assessment Office for a liquefied natural gas (LNG) project. The David Suzuki Foundation, Sierra Club BC, Stand.earth, the Wilderness Committee and Northwest Institute are calling on the EAO to address the myriad flaws in the application and compel the proponent to undertake a comprehensive analysis that considers its climate, electrification strategy, wild salmon health and Indigenous rights implications. In alignment with the Gitanyow Hereditary Chiefs‚Äô plea, we advocate for a pause in the environmental assessment process for the LNG project until essential studies are completed, and credible evidence supporting the proponents‚Äô assertions is provided. Issues raised should be addressed by the company before the Gitanyow Wilp Sustainability Assessment Process and the environmental assessment process can proceed. The Ksi Lisims application builds its net-zero claims around project electrification with no guarantee that it will be viable and without considering that the costs associated with prioritizing electrification of the fossil fuel sector could hinder necessary electrification beyond the sector throughout B.C. The project also relies excessively on offsets for emissions mitigation, an unproven approach that detracts from the application‚Äôs credibility. The best way to avoid emissions isn‚Äôt through offset schemes, but by not building new fossil fuel projects. This is consistent with the commitments made at COP28 and with the overwhelming scientific consensus regarding the critical importance of phasing out fossil fuel development. The proponent does not credibly evaluate the emissions from burning the fuels in countries they‚Äôre exported to. This narrow approach is no longer defensible in the context of the intensifying climate crisis. If Ksi Lisims were to proceed, emissions in receiving countries would amount to 32.2 MT CO2e annually (equivalent to about half of B.C.‚Äôs annual emissions) for the life of the project. As pointed out by climate-policy experts, governments concerned about domestic emissions can no longer turn a blind eye to the grave planetary and human rights consequences associated with exporting fossil fuels and their emissions. Contrary to industry claims, there is no guarantee that B.C. LNG exports would displace coal rather than simply locking out investment in renewable energy. Finally, as the International Energy Agency and other energy market analysts point out, repeatedly, the project is not justified since the LNG market is entering a period of oversupply, with the growing risk of stranded assets for any new projects. ### Media contacts: - Theresa Beer, [tbeer@davidsuzuki.org](mailto:tbeer@davidsuzuki.org) - Sven Biggs, [sven@stand.earth](mailto:sven@stand.earth) - Peter McCartney, [peter@wildernesscommittee.org](mailto:peter@wildernesscommittee.org) - Pat Moss, [pat@northwestinstitute.ca](mailto:pat@northwestinstitute.ca) - Dr. Shelley Luce, [shelley@sierraclub.bc.ca](mailto:shelley@sierraclub.bc.ca)
